children.value: s are WebGL Objects that contain textures. They are optimized for use as render targets, while vanilla

s may not be, and are the logical choice when you do not need to sample (i.e. in a post-pass shader) from the produced image. If you do need to sample (such as when reading depth back in a second shader pass), use
const renderbuffer = new Renderbuffer(gl, {format: GL.RGBA4, width: 100, height: 100});

const renderbuffer = new Renderbuffer(gl, {format: GL.RGBA4, width: 100, height: 100});
renderbuffer.initialize({format: GL.RGB565, width: 50, height: 50});

const renderbuffer = new Renderbuffer(gl, {format: GL.RGBA4});
renderbuffer.resize({width: 200, height: 200});

framebuffer.attach({
  [GL.DEPTH_ATTACHMENT]: new Renderbuffer(gl, {format: GL.DEPTH_COMPONENT16})
 });
